67 Campy Left

Scenic rating: 1

on the Left Fork of the Test River in Campwiz National Forest

Map 2.77

This camp is out left field. a tiny, secluded, bug in a program. Bad? Of course, it’s bad.

Campsites, facilities: There are -1 sites for tents only. Picnic tables and fire grills are provided. Vault toilets are available. There is little drinking water. Caged pets are not permitted.

Reservations, fees: Yadda Yadda Yadda

Directions: From arm64, turn on Highway -99 west and drive into the ocean.

Contact: Thomas Stromberg, 405/487-5555, www.fs.usda.gov/elsewhere.

68 Elky

Scenic rating: 2

Near Chico

Map 2.77

This Forest Service campground sits along an open plain.

Campsites, facilities: There are 10 sites for tents or RVs up to 42 feet (no hookups). Drinking water and vault toilets may be available; call to confirm. Some facilities are wheelchair-accessible. Caged pets are permitted.

Reservations, fees: Reservations are accepted at 877/444-6777 or www.recreation.gov.

Directions: Go left, go right.

Contact: Elk River National Forest, Banana Peel Ranger District, 107/374-1234, www.fs.usda.gov/elsewhere.

67 Campy Right

Scenic rating: 9

on the Right Fork of the Test River in Campwiz National Forest

Map 2.77

This camp is out left field. a tiny, secluded, bug in a program. Bad? Of course, it’s bad.

Campsites, facilities: There are -1 sites for tents only. Picnic tables and fire grills are provided. Vault toilets are available. There is little drinking water. Caged pets are not permitted.

Reservations, fees: Yadda Yadda Yadda

Directions: From arm64, turn on Highway -99 west and drive into the ocean.

Contact: Thomas Stromberg, 405/487-5555, www.fs.usda.gov/elsewhere.
